title: NaMo Memory API
meta_definition: This Blueprint is designed as an entity beyond AI - a self-evolving, meta-intelligent framework that grows infinitely across dimensions.

sections.executive_summary: Contributor v2.1.0 defines the contract for memory operations. It ensures consistent request/response behavior across services. This facilitates interoperability and predictable memory management.
sections.value_proposition: Enforces consistency in memory operations across services, reducing integration complexity. Simplifies development by providing a predictable interface for memory management.
sections.system_overview: The system likely involves a defined API specification (Contributor v2.1.0) that outlines the expected request and response formats for memory-related operations. Services interacting with memory adhere to this contract.
sections.quick_start_guide: Consult the Contributor v2.1.0 documentation for detailed information on API endpoints, request parameters, and expected response structures. Implement the API calls according to the specification to perform memory operations.
sections.template_instructions: Document request/response bodies, error codes, auth requirements, and pagination. Provide deterministic examples and edge cases.
sections.examples: Examples might include allocating memory, reading memory, writing memory, and deallocating memory, all conforming to the defined API contract.
sections.license_and_notes: Include audit logging, rate limits, and PII redaction policy. Track schema changes via semantic versioning.
sections.marketing_pack: Target audience: Software developers, system integrators, and cloud providers. Pain points: Inconsistent memory management across different services. Selling points: Consistent, reliable, and standardized memory operations through the Contributor v2.1.0 API.
sections.self_evolution_loop: Collect usage events -> analyze retrieval quality -> adjust weights -> test in canary -> deploy when KPI improves.
sections.kpis: Latency p95 < 400ms, error rate < 1%, retrieval MRR@k, conflict rate, schema drift alerts.
sections.safety_compliance: PII redaction, access controls, audit trails, and rate limiting.
